intro: Pyrethrum leucanthemoides, commonly known as the white marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are white with yellow centers, making it a popular ornamental plant. Pyrethrum leucanthemoides is also valued for its use in phytotherapy due to its mild sedative properties.
